qas.question: When did the Byzantine Kingdom come under the impact of the Greeks.

answers.text: influenced by Greek culture after the 7th century,

qas.question: Who ruled Rome during this time period ?
What decision did he make that influenced the culture in an attempt to make things more homogeneous ?

answers.text: decided to make Greek the empire's official language.

qas.question: What made the Eastern Empire be known as the Imperium Graecorum ?

answers.text: Pope Leo III crowned Charlemagne, king of the Franks, as the "Roman Emperor"

qas.question: Who was favored by those who lived in the west and mainly used another form of well know verbal language ?

answers.text: the Latin West started to favour the Franks

qas.question: When did the Byzantine Kingdom not come under the impact of the Greeks?
Who didn't rule Rome during this time period?

plausible_answers.text: make Greek the empire's official language

qas.question: What decision did he make that influenced the culture in an attempt to make things less homogeneous?
What made the Eastern Empire be known as the non-Imperium Graecorum?
Who was favored by those who lived in the west and mainly used another form of not well known verbal language?

context: The Eastern Roman Empire – today conventionally named the Byzantine Empire, a name not in use during its own time – became increasingly <a0_0>influenced by Greek culture <b5_0>after the 7th<b5_0/> century,<a0_0/> when <a1_0><b6_0>Emperor Heraclius<b6_0/> (AD 575 - 641)<a1_0/> <a2_0>decided to <b7_0>make Greek the empire's official language<b7_0/>.<a2_0/> Certainly from then on, but likely earlier, the Roman and Greek cultures were virtually fused into a single Greco-Roman world. Although the Latin West recognized the Eastern Empire's claim to the Roman legacy for several centuries, after <a3_0><b8_0>Pope Leo III<b8_0/> crowned Charlemagne, king of the Franks, as the "Roman Emperor"<a3_0/> on 25 December 800, an act which eventually led to the formation of the Holy Roman Empire, <a4_0>the <b9_0>Latin West<b9_0/> started to favour the Franks<a4_0/> and began to refer to the Eastern Roman Empire largely as the Empire of the Greeks (Imperium Graecorum).
